meanings.definition: A large administrative division in Inner Mongolia, China.
meanings.sent1: The ordos in Inner Mongolia is responsible for managing a vast area.
meanings.sent2: The ordos in China play a crucial role in governing the region.
meanings.sent3: The ordos in Inner Mongolia decided to have a picnic to discuss important matters.
meanings.sent4: The ordos of the region stood tall like mighty guardians protecting their land.
meanings.sent5: The ordos oversaw the distribution of resources with precision and care.

meanings.definition: A type of architectural order in ancient Roman and Greek architecture.
meanings.sent1: The beautiful ordos in the ancient building showcased intricate designs.
meanings.sent2: Architects often incorporate the ordos into their designs to add elegance.
meanings.sent3: The ordos in the old temple seemed to whisper stories of the past.
meanings.sent4: The ordos of the columns stood like soldiers guarding the entrance.
meanings.sent5: The ordos of the structure added a touch of grandeur to the architecture.

meanings.definition: A group of people or things arranged in a particular order or sequence.
meanings.sent1: The students formed an ordos to line up for the school assembly.
meanings.sent2: The books on the shelf were neatly placed in an ordos according to size.
meanings.sent3: The ordos of colorful balloons created a festive atmosphere at the party.
meanings.sent4: The cars parked in an ordos resembled a colorful mosaic from above.
meanings.sent5: The flowers in the garden bloomed in a perfect ordos, creating a beautiful pattern.
